.NET Framework 3.5.name: VRTK_BaseJointGrabAttach
.NET Framework 3.5.summary: The Base Joint Grab Attach script is an abstract class that all joint grab attach types inherit.
.NET Framework 3.5.remarks: As this is an abstract class, it cannot be applied directly to a game object and performs no logic.

methods.name: DestroyJoint(bool withDestroyImmediate, bool applyGrabbingObjectVelocity)
methods.syntax: protected virtual void DestroyJoint(bool withDestroyImmediate, bool applyGrabbingObjectVelocity)
methods.linkedSyntax: protected virtual void DestroyJoint(bool withDestroyImmediate, bool applyGrabbingObjectVelocity)

methods.name: SnapObjectToGrabToController(GameObject obj)
StartGrab(GameObject grabbingObject, GameObject givenGrabbedObject, Rigidbody givenControllerAttachPoint)
methods.summary: The StartGrab method sets up the grab attach mechanic as soon as an object is grabbed. It is also responsible for creating the joint on the grabbed object.
methods.returns: Is true if the grab is successful, false if the grab is unsuccessful.

params.value: The object that is doing the grabbing.
The point on the grabbing object that the grabbed object should be attached to after grab occurs.

methods.syntax: public bool StartGrab(GameObject grabbingObject, GameObject givenGrabbedObject, Rigidbody givenControllerAttachPoint)
methods.linkedSyntax: public bool StartGrab(GameObject grabbingObject, GameObject givenGrabbedObject, Rigidbody givenControllerAttachPoint)

methods.name: StopGrab(bool applyGrabbingObjectVelocity)
methods.summary: The StopGrab method ends the grab of the current object and cleans up the state. It is also responsible for removing the joint from the grabbed object.

params.value: If true will apply the current velocity of the grabbing object to the grabbed object on release.

methods.name: ValidGrab(Rigidbody checkAttachPoint)
methods.summary: The ValidGrab method determines if the grab attempt is valid.
methods.returns: Returns true if there is no current grab happening, or the grab is initiated by another grabbing object.
